item.title: Is the gig economy protected by EU law? Conflicting opinions in the CJEU's legal decisions
item.description:
Dr Maria Tzanakopoulou, Teaching Fellow, King’s College London and University College London BACKGROUND The expanding gig economy is sparking debates about working conditions, including issues like working hours, pay, parental leave, and the crucial classification of gig workers. The case of King is the first time the Court of Justice of the European Union (CJEU) has ruled on business conduct and worker rights in this sector.
